src:
General Election LIVE: Latest news as Boris Johnson takes no deal off the table
02 Nov 2019, 12:44 by https://www.facebook.com/SunPolitics/

BORIS JOHNSON has taken no deal off the table in the party's forthcoming manifesto.

The Prime Minister has said he will focus on “getting Brexit done immediately” once MPs have returned to the House of Commons after the general election in December.

























Thomas Mackie1 minute agoNovember 2, 2019WELL DONE ENGLAND South Africa broke the hearts of all Brits this morning to win their third Rugby World Cup. Former Prime Minister Theresa May tweeted: “Well done England. Not the outcome we were hoping for today but incredibly proud of your performance throughout RWC2019.” While David Cameron said: ” Heartfelt commiserations England, but you can hold your heads high after a terrific and well fought tournament – we're proud of you. And many congratulations South Africa; great final and thoroughly well-deserved victory. “
Jon Rogers2 hours agoNovember 2, 2019TOUCHING MOMENT SNP leader Nicola Sturgeon is expected to tell a rally in Glasgow later today an independent Scotland is “within touching distance”. She is expected to tell pro-independence supporters “another clear win” for the SNP in the general election will “bring it closer still”. Ms Sturgeon is the headline speaker at the event in George Square later today.
Jon Rogers2 hours agoNovember 2, 2019TORY MANIFESTO PLEDGES Along with removing a no-deal Brexit from the table, the forthcoming Conservative manifesto is also thought to commit the party to a number of tax pledges. These include: a pledge to continue the fuel duty freeze extending free childcare for three and four-year-olds a rise in the threshold at which people start paying national insurance raise the threshold for the 40p rate of income tax from £50,000 to £80,000
Thomas Mackie3 hours agoNovember 2, 2019DELIVER ON THE ISSUES THAT MATTER Boris Johnson has said: “We need to ensure our country has a new, functioning majority government that can deliver on the issues that matter to the British people.”
Thomas Mackie3 hours agoNovember 2, 2019RUGBY GETS POLITICAL After Boris Johnson issued a message of support for the England rugby team ahead of the World Cup final in Japan, pundit Brian Moore told him to “f**k off”.

Load more entries…
